events.message: The claimant reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision on the highway causing moderate damage to the rear bumper.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords including car, collision, and accident found in the initial report.
An insurance agent has been assigned to the claim to guide the customer through the process and answer any questions.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and confirmed initiation of the claim process.
The claimant was requested to submit a copy of the car repair estimate, police report, and photos of the damage for further investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents including insurance forms, police report, and repair estimates promptly.
The insurance investigator began reviewing the submitted evidence and assessing liability and damage extent regarding the car collision.
Investigation was completed confirming the claimant was not at fault and damages matched submitted documentation.
A settlement offer covering full repair costs was proposed to the claimant based on investigation outcomes and policy coverage.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the responsiveness and fairness of the proposed settlement offer after the accident.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department following the customer's acceptance of the settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the repair shop for the vehicle damage as per the approved settlement amount.
The auto accident claim was closed following successful payment and resolution of all outstanding issues with the customer.
